comments: In this project-based course, students will design and develop an application for an embedded systems platform, and then investigate low-level performance tuning and optimization. This course incorporates topics from the domains of software engineering, compilers, operating systems, and computer architecture, and provides students with the foundation they will need for addressing the concerns of developing real-world embedded systems.   Students generally found the course “useful” course and felt that it provided “great hand-on experience” and a lot of Android programming. One student noted, however, that the goals of the course seemed unfocused as topics were not addressed fully.  Students generally described Professor Murphy as “very good,” and many felt that he gave a “solid run for the first time the course was offered.”  Students are expected to be proficient in both C and Java. Prerequisites include CIS 120 and CIS 121, one of CIS 371, CIS 501, MCIT 593, and (recommended) CIS 380, CIS 505 (co-requisite), MCIT 595 (co-requisite).
